TRANSPORTATION TERMINAL CIRCULATION DIAGRAM

PEDESTRIAN ACCESS
BUS CIRCULATION



Transit is an integral part of Charles Center. The great
Transportation Terminal, largest of the three transit

facilities, is entered by pedestrians from the public park
above. Eight escalators carry passengers up or down from

the loading docks. The escalators can be reversed depending EXISTING BALTIMORE TRANSIT ROUTES
on the direction of the rush. in the Central Business District

. showing Charles Center Transportation
Local transit vehicles enter from Hopkins Place, loading and Terminal and Transit Depots

unloading from the 20 spaces at the four docks. Out-of-town
buses use eleven angle bays. The local and out-of-town
